channel.title: Jupyter Notebooks on Monte Carlo & Linear Regression Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Jupyter Notebooks on Monte Carlo & Linear Regression Documentation

item.title: Installation
item.description: To install Jupyter Notebooks The fastest way to install Jupyter Notebooks (assuming you have Python3 already installed), is to run pip3 install jupyter If you need more information how to install Jupyter, please follow this link Getting Started With Jupyter Notebooks Run the following command to open up the application: jupyter notebook You will see the application open in your default browser using the following address: http://localhost:8888

item.title: How To Use
item.description: How to test sample notebooks using Jupyter Notebooks? Download the notebooks source code after installing Jupyter on your computer. To be able to perform estimations, download full repositories with Monte Carlo Simulation and Linear Regression sample code. Once the sample source code repository is downloaded to the local environment, proceed with the following command to start Jupyter notebooks locally: jupyter notebook Default browser will launch Jupyter Labs.
